thread.title: Ronaldo says Saudi league ‘more competitive’ than French - Sportstar
thread.title_full: Ronaldo says Saudi league ‘more competitive’ than French - Sportstar

author: AFP
title: Ronaldo says Saudi league ‘more competitive’ than French - Sportstar
text: Cristiano Ronaldo insisted Friday that the often derided Saudi Pro League was “more competitive” than French Ligue 1. “To be honest, I think the Saudi championship isn’t worse than the French championship. I think it’s more competitive,” five-time Ballon d’Or winner Ronaldo told the Globe Soccer Awards in Dubai. Ronaldo was the first major star to move to Saudi Arabia when he penned a deal with Al-Nassr last January. Voting lines now open for Sportstar ACES Awards 2024 The likes of France’s Karim Benzema, Brazilian star Neymar and Senegalese striker Sadio Mane have also left Europe behind for bumper pay packets in the Gulf kingdom. Asked about the level of the Saudi Pro League, Ronaldo added: “They can say what they want, it’s just my opinion. I have played there for a year so I know what I’m talking about. “I think that now we are better than the French championship and we continue to improve.” [Latest on Sportstar](/latest-news/) Pro Kabaddi League PKL Season 10 LIVE Score: Dabang Delhi 33-27 U Mumba; Pawan Sehrawat in action later Gabriel helps Arsenal end 3-game losing streak with its 5-0 win over Crystal Palace Indian table tennis in 2024: India’s fortunes tied to Paris exploits Ranji Trophy 2024: Tilak Varma hits second consecutive century, Hyderabad hammers Sikkim by an innings and 198 runs AFCON 2024: Tanzania replaces head coach after just one game at African Cup of Nations [READ MORE STORIES](/latest-news/)
